alert.note: Alert for Callahan; Shackelford (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 26 at 12:17PM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EASTERN CALLAHAN AND SOUTHEASTERN SHACKELFORD COUNTIES THROUGH 100 PM CST... At 1216 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorms near Admiral, or near Baird, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Baird, Moran, Putnam, Rowden, Atwell, Ibex, Admiral, Us- 283 Near The Callahan-Shackelford County Line, and I- 20 Near The Callahan-Eastland County Line. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 303 and 323. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
